intro: Rhacoma tonduzii, commonly known as the Tonduzii spurge, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, clustered yellow flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Rhacoma tonduzii is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its striking foliage and resilience.
